intro: Tephrosia belizensis, commonly known as the Belize tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Belize. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in open woodlands or along forest edges. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by pods containing seeds, and it has a shallow root system adapted to well-drained soils. Tephrosia belizensis is also noted for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural insecticides.
